channel.title: 443 Refactored [2006 Christmas Client]
channel.description:
As some of you may know, I stopped my 474 refactoring project in favor of refactoring the 443. I'm starting from a deob I acquired myself using a couple tools out there to make the code easier to read, which includes most XOR number compares, unnecessary bit shift numbers, etc... You can get the deob and more information about it [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,555060.0.html]here[/url].
Anyway, I'm going to be refactoring a lot of it to write a server for it. Just as before, all my work will be available on Google Code for checkout using SVN. I won't be posting my changes here unless they're major, so look at the revision logs for changes.
[b][url=https://code.google.com/p/443refactored/source/browse/]Google Code Project Page[/url][/b]
~Lin

item.title: 443 Refactored [2006 Christmas Client]
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:10, topic:452312”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=555200.msg4066015#msg4066015 date=1343890990]
Alright my bad. This will be interesting, the only reason why I’d use a more modern client is because the updating system was more-sane than with the 317 client. Sucks that the maps are encrypted
[/quote]Indeed it does The updating looks to be the exact same - like literally no difference except for the byte types and bit orders :P[/quote]

Let me get back to you on that. Do you have a copy of the Class64?

edit:

Going to guess that this is the correct source for that class.

[code]import java.applet.Applet;
import netscape.javascript.JSObject;

public class Class64
{
public static Object method1091(String paramString, int paramInt, Applet paramApplet)
throws Throwable
{
return JSObject.getWindow(paramApplet).eval(paramString);
}
}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:7, topic:452312”]I might actually upgrade to this if ALL the maps are present in the cache.

Edit:

Eh I figure I can just load 317 maps if need be. Can you point me to the cache you are using Lin?[/quote]Like I said, I’m using the cache in the deob I linked but with dumped maps. I don’t have any working keys or know anyone that does.

Read full topic

item.title: 443 Refactored [2006 Christmas Client]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:5, topic:452312”]ps 443 isnt 06[/quote]Yes it is, unless they updated the client between Christmas of 2006 and 2007, which I doubt. 438 was Hunter, which was November 21st, IIRC. That leaves 5 weeks for 2006, which brings it to 443.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:4, topic:452312”]Also are there any landscape cipher keys for this revision? I’d be interested in rewriting a bit of what I know. I could make a version that just loads to the main screen, toggle RSA/ISAAC if it’d help people create servers for this revision.

Edit:

I wonder if the format is actually similar. I’m curious so I’ll download it anyway. I’m just mainly looking for the abstraction for loading stages.[/quote]I don’t believe so. I have it loading dumped maps, which I’m pretty sure are 474s. I’m already working on a server and have figured out quite a bit, and have finally gotten the world to show:

The reason it took so long was because there’s a flag in the client that when set, it resets all of the clicks and won’t let you interact with anything or show the world. It’ll still read and write packets, but that’s about it. After tracing a million things in the client to finally find it, this method here has to return 0 for it to be unset:

public static int method586(boolean bool, boolean bool_20_, int i) { int i_21_ = i; if (bool_20_) i_21_ += Class1.anInt31 + Class39_Sub5_Sub6.anInt1765; if (bool) i_21_ += Class41.anInt766 + Canvas_Sub1.anInt21; return i_21_; }I don’t know what any the variables it’s grabbing mean, but when I force it to return 0, the client is perfectly fine. I’ll have to look into what the values are, because there’s probably a packet that resets them.

[quote=“t4, post:3, topic:452312”]i demand scheenshots; does this incl the cache?[/quote]The project page doesn’t, but the download in the Downloads section does. I just updated the client, so if anyone wants to take a look at it, go ahead. There’s still a ton of refactoring to be done, especially with things I already know, but it’s better than using the deob.

Read full topic

item.title: 443 Refactored [2006 Christmas Client]

item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Also are there any landscape cipher keys for this revision? I’d be interested in rewriting a bit of what I know. I could make a version that just loads to the main screen, toggle RSA/ISAAC if it’d help people create servers for this revision.

Edit:

I wonder if the format is actually similar. I’m curious so I’ll download it anyway. I’m just mainly looking for the abstraction for loading stages.

Read full topic
